sen.j: 日置浄足（へきのきよたり、生没年不明)は奈良時代の官人。
sen.e: HEKI no Kiyotari (浄足) (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official (lower or middle ranked) of Nara period.
HEKI no Kiyotari (浄足) (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official (lower or middle ranked) of Nara period.
HEKI no Kiyotari (浄足) (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official (lower or middle ranked) of Nara period.
Another theory about the letters for his given name is 清足.
Another theory about the letters for his given name is 清足.
Another theory about the letters for his given name is 清足.
He worked as kyoji (a craftsman who mounts calligraphy or paintings on scroll or sliding doors).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He worked as kyoji (a craftsman who mounts calligraphy or paintings on scroll or sliding doors).
He worked as kyoji (a craftsman who mounts calligraphy or paintings on scroll or sliding doors).

sen.j: 大初位上から正八位上に昇り、図書少允などを務めた。
sen.e: He was promoted from Daihatsuinojo (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) to Shohachiinojo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) and served as shojo (Junior Secretary) of Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was promoted from Daihatsuinojo (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) to Shohachiinojo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) and served as shojo (Junior Secretary) of Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) and so on.

He was promoted from Daihatsuinojo (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade) to Shohachiinojo (Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) and served as shojo (Junior Secretary) of Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) and so on.
